articles.headline: Marco Rubio Gets Party’s Blessing, but Not Voters’
articles.snippet: Mr. Rubio’s time is quickly running out, according to even his own supporters, who are offering increasingly candid assessments of his chances.
articles.abstract: Mr. Rubio’s time is quickly running out, according to even his own supporters, who are offering increasingly candid assessments of his chances.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Marco Rubio has persuaded wealthy donors, Republican Party elders and his colleagues in Congress that he represents their best chance to overtake the seemingly invincible force that is Donald J. Trump.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Jeremy W. Peters

articles.headline: Republican Race Puts Donald Trump and Paul Ryan on Collision Course
articles.snippet: As Mr. Trump inches closer to being the party’s presidential nominee, Republicans fear he won’t back the conservative agenda pushed by Mr. Ryan, the House speaker.
articles.abstract: As Mr. Trump inches closer to being the party’s presidential nominee, Republicans fear he won’t back the conservative agenda pushed by Mr. Ryan, the House speaker.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Speaker Paul D. Ryan, chairman of the Republican National Convention, recent vice-presidential candidate and the highest elected Republican in the country, has one goal for this year: to form a conservative policy agenda for the Republican presidential nominee to embrace.

articles.headline: Tips and Myths About Extending Smartphone Battery Life
articles.snippet: We teamed up with The Wirecutter to determine the best methods for preventing your phone from going dark.
articles.abstract: We teamed up with The Wirecutter to determine the best methods for preventing your phone from going dark.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ashlei Temeña’s family trip to Disneyland last Thanksgiving break turned into a nightmare when her smartphone battery hit empty.

articles.headline: Falling Oil Prices Force Cutbacks at Smallest Companies
articles.snippet: Small operators in several states are cutting back on expenses to try to hold down debt.
articles.abstract: Small operators in several states are cutting back on expenses to try to hold down debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEMINOLE, Okla. — The plunging price of crude has inflicted pain in the Oklahoma oil patch, and now it is threatening to take out the smallest of the small operators, those that have survived decades of booms and busts.

articles.headline: Apple Is Said to Be Trying to Make It Harder to Hack iPhones
articles.snippet: Concerned about the government’s insistence that it break into a terrorist’s phone, the company wants to take that power out of its own hands.
articles.abstract: Concerned about the government’s insistence that it break into a terrorist’s phone, the company wants to take that power out of its own hands.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Apple engineers have begun developing new security measures that would make it impossible for the government to break into a locked iPhone using methods similar to those now at the center of a court fight in California, according to people close to the company and security experts.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo and Katie Benner

articles.headline: Treasury Plan for Puerto Rico Favors Pensions Over Bondholders
articles.snippet: A plan from the Treasury Department to ease Puerto Rico’s debt crisis would put pension payments ahead of payments to bondholders, which may rattle the muni market.
articles.abstract: A plan from the Treasury Department to ease Puerto Rico’s debt crisis would put pension payments ahead of payments to bondholders, which may rattle the muni market.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If it’s up to the Treasury Department, public employees in Puerto Rico who were promised pensions could be better off than investors who bought the island’s bonds.

articles.headline: Poorest Areas Have Missed Out on Boons of Recovery, Study Finds
articles.snippet: A new research and advocacy group found that since the end of the recession, the divide between wealthy and poor communities had widened further.
articles.abstract: A new research and advocacy group found that since the end of the recession, the divide between wealthy and poor communities had widened further.
articles.lead_paragraph: The gap between the richest and poorest American communities has widened since the Great Recession ended, and distressed areas are faring worse just as the recovery is gaining traction across much of the country.

articles.headline: As China’s Economic Picture Turns Uglier, Beijing Applies Airbrush
articles.snippet: With troubles threatening to undermine confidence in the Communist Party, leaders are tightening the flow of information.
articles.abstract: With troubles threatening to undermine confidence in the Communist Party, leaders are tightening the flow of information.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — This month, Chinese banking officials omitted currency data from closely watched economic reports.
articles.byline: By Edward Wong and Neil Gough

articles.headline: Donald Trump to Foreign Workers for Florida Club: You’re Hired
articles.snippet: Aided by an oft-debated visa program, Mr. Trump’s resort frequently aims to hire temporary guest workers from Romania and other nations.
articles.abstract: Aided by an oft-debated visa program, Mr. Trump’s resort frequently aims to hire temporary guest workers from Romania and other nations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago Club in Palm Beach, Fla., describes itself as “one of the most highly regarded private clubs in the world,” and it is not just the very-well-to-do who want to get in.
articles.byline: By Charles V. Bagli and Megan Twohey
